meanings.definition: Relating to a system of government in which priests rule in the name of God.
meanings.sent1: The theocratic society was governed by priests who claimed to act on behalf of God.
meanings.sent2: The theocratic leaders made decisions based on religious beliefs.
meanings.sent3: In the theocratic community, even the smallest decisions were made with divine guidance.
meanings.sent4: The theocratic rule was as absolute as the word of God.
meanings.sent5: Living in a theocratic state meant following religious laws above all else.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a government controlled by religious leaders.
meanings.sent1: The theocratic government was influenced by the beliefs of religious leaders.
meanings.sent2: People in the theocratic regime looked to religious figures for guidance.
meanings.sent3: The theocratic council met to discuss matters of both faith and governance.
meanings.sent4: The influence of the theocratic leaders extended beyond politics.
meanings.sent5: Being part of a theocratic system meant following the teachings of the religious authorities.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a system of government in which religious leaders hold political power.
meanings.sent1: The theocratic rulers held both religious and political authority.
meanings.sent2: The theocratic society was governed by religious figures with political influence.
meanings.sent3: Living in a theocratic nation meant following laws based on religious doctrines.
meanings.sent4: The theocratic system intertwined religious beliefs with political decisions.
meanings.sent5: In the theocratic state, religious leaders had the final say in all matters of governance.
